channel.title: Army
channel.description: Well as many of you no im leaving for the army well i leave tommorow i wont have the internet for a while i wouldnt say im leaving because like many others id comeback just not as often so id like to say see you guys later ect.

item.title: Army
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

Here you go guys so you can compare marine corps and navy casualties in World War II
Website = http://www.history.navy.mil/faqs/faq11-1.htm
Read bottom of for total, 2:1 ratio.

[code]US Navy and Marine Corps Casualty Statistics for World War II

Source:
US Navy. Bureau of Medicine and Surgery. History of the Medical Departmentof the United States Navy in World War II: The Statistics of Diseases and Injuries. vol.3. Washington: Government Printing Office, 1950. OCLC 04067096.

This history lists the Navy and Marine Corps personnel who were killed in action with the enemy, died of wounds, and died as a prisoner of war, as well as those who were discharged from the service because of their wounds (invalided from service.)
The history provides statistics by officer and enlisted, but for the purpose of this summary, these numbers are totaled for each service.

Place of action KIA Wounded, Died, Invalided
died later POW from service

North African landings
Navy 472 17 0 80
Marine 3 1 0 1

Sicilian landings
Navy 521 24 0 33
Marine 1 0 0 1

Italian landings
Navy 788 31 1 74
Marine 0 0 0 0

Landings in Southern France
Navy 36 8 0 20
Marine 0 0 0 0

Invasion of France
Navy 1068 32 2 263
Marine 0 0 0 0

Atlantic or Caribbean area unspecified
Navy 2443 14 0 79
Marine 1 0 0 1

Attack on Pearl Harbor
Navy 1744 17 2 41
Marine 99 2 0 6

Fall of the Philippines
Navy 337 2 630 3
Marine 89 0 413 1

Netherlands, East Indies engagement
Navy 1656 12 94 7
Marine 36 0 7 0

Pacific raids
Navy 40 0 4 2
Marine 0 1 0 0

Battle of Coral Sea
Navy 537 6 1 11
Marine 19 2 0 0

Battle of Midway
Navy 301 8 1 15
Marine 39 1 0 1

Guadalcanal, Tulagi landings
Navy 1176 20 2 85
Marine 988 77 12 365

Battle of Savo Island
Navy 936 11 0 51
Marine 33 0 0 2

Battle of Eastern Solomons
Navy 85 4 0 4
Marine 0 1 0 1

Battle of Cape Esperance
Navy 168 1 0 5
Marine 7 0 0 1

Battle of Santa Cruz Islands
Navy 242 5 0 16
Marine 12 3 0 0

Battle of Guadalcanal
Navy 971 20 2 62
Marine 10 1 0 8

Battle of Tassafaronga
Navy 389 8 0 8
Marine 0 0 0 0

Capture of remaining Solomons
Navy 1246 56 0 174
Marine 781 68 26 277

Battle of Tarawa
Navy 724 3 0 23
Marine 950 34 0 210

Battle of Cape Gloucester
Navy 145 9 0 20
Marine 325 33 2 157

Invasion of Marshall Islands
Navy 187 3 1 44
Marine 401 34 0 141

Invasion of Marianas
Navy 513 43 1 228
Marine 3995 342 0 2138

Invasion of Palau Islands
Navy 185 10 0 68
Marine 1171 101 1 681

Landings on Biak New Guinea
Navy 164 6 0 40
Marine 0 0 0 0

Bombardment of Truk
Navy 78 3 0 12
Marine 7 0 0 1

Return to the Philippines
Navy 4026 270 40 830
Marine 132 10 1 25

Battle of Iwo Jima
Navy 934 48 0 349
Marine 4907 614 0 3114

Bombardments of Formosa French Indochina
Navy 269 9 2 30
Marine 3 0 0 1

Bombing and landing on Okinawa
Navy 3809 219 0 876
Marine 2897 347 0 2028

Bombardment of Kyushu Island and Japan
Navy 963 6 1 38
Marine 61 0 0 3

Aleutian or Alaskan area, unspecified
Navy 177 1 0 8
Marine 2 0 0 5

Pacific or Asiatic area, unspecified
Navy 4462 12 93 188
Marine 20 0 1 1

After 1 July 1945
Navy 1103 14 2 88
Marine 41 0 4 172

Specific action not determined
Navy 1719 20 30 773
Marine 346 10 43 721

Total, all actions
Navy 34607 972 909 4647
Marine 17376 1682 510 10063
Total 51983 2654 1419 14710[/code]

item.title: Army
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

The USMC was never the massive, amazing, fighting force people make it out to be. In world war two, the Russians fucked Hitler over, and it was the air force & navy that won the war against Japan. In Vietnam, the marines were getting raped every 30 seconds, and the air force had to come and bail that out. And in the last two Gulf Wars, its been mainly the air force & special forces that are making progress. The only reason that the USMC is praised as much as they are, is because of the media.

Read full topic

item.title: Army
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:47, topic:323566”][quote author=HerecomestheKraken! link=topic=419970.msg3129885#msg3129885 date=1266368944]
Give me straight proof that there is something better than a Marine… I might have a little doubt.
[/quote]There is no proof needed behind sex, drugs, and rock & roll.

Pertaining to the topic, I hear to become a marine you need to be drowned and brought back to consciousness as initiation into the department; is this true?[/quote]
I HIGHLY doubt that, that sounds something you’d see in the Spetsnaz or Israeli special forces. Closest thing I can think to that is the Navy frogmen’s training “Drown proofing”, where they train you to hold your breath for 5~ minutes, if you cannot pass this you fail so one would have to be fairly aerobically fit.

HerecomestheKraken!:

Give me straight proof that there is something better than a Marine… I might have a little doubt.

You’re obviously to wound around the USMC because the American media has made it like that. If you’re saying the USMC is the finest fighting force you’re on crack. My money would be on Ghurka’s, SAS or Delta Force; possibly the Spetsnaz. I don’t even think Marines are the main recon forces anymore; it’s the SEALs. If the Marine Force Recon was still around, it’d be up there for sure.

You wanted proof:
I chose to pull the statistics from the Vietnam war.
Volunteer 40,484
Draftees 17,725
^ above is the casualties of the USArF. I believe the correct figure is 32% of the men killed were US Marines. Ofcourse, it’d be a bit difficult to pull the exact amount of SAS killed, it will be a lot lower than that because one would think there is not even that many in the SAS.

However, comparing the two is stupid. Marines are Infantry of the Navy. (Don’t bother debating this, they said it themselves) They’re not better trained than the Army, they just specialize in Amphibious Warfare. Whereas SAS, Delta Force, Ghurka’s and all that are special forces. But, claiming the USMC is the finest fighting force is a terrible statement. Friendly fire was the result of like a third of deaths by the USArF in the Gulf War.

[quote=“AMERIKA, post:48, topic:323566”][quote author=HerecomestheKraken! link=topic=419970.msg3129885#msg3129885 date=1266368944]
And no, I’m not a 13 years old. I’m 19.
[/quote]
what the fuck are you doing here?

[size=36pt]ENLIST MOTHER FUCKER[/size][/quote]
You remind me of the local recruitment clerk; you’ve never had anything to do with the armed forces and you sound like a fucking commercial. Have you enlisted?

EDIT: spelling yoh

Read full topic

item.title: Army
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

HerecomestheKraken!:

Their causes? Dude, they don’t really have a choice.

I’m not going to go into the technicalities because really none of us know what it is like over there. You claiming to of been in the USMC makes me laugh, seeing as I doubt you’re over the age of 13. So with your logic, the Coalition is fighting a force that don’t want to fight, and yet the Coalition still hasn’t won? This war has gone longer than both the World Wars, and we’re still getting nowhere, and we never will.

But to have a go at me saying I am talking shit to men who gave everything they had for their country, that’s complete rubbish. I admire every aspect of them, they’re my heroes. I am merely stating the USMC should not be respected nowhere near as much as it is. It is not the finest fighting force everyone thinks it is; are you forgetting about your Delta Forces or Green Berets? Or our SAS? Or your Navy SEALs?

Think before you talk, moron. You’re right, I don’t like the USMC, I never have. 98% of them are nobel, admirable servicemen, however there is still a lot of Marines that are there that shouldn’t be. (I’m talking about CPL Mooti, the Marine massacre, or the Marine rapeings etc)

You get very worked up when I have a dig at your Marines, yet when they returned from Vietnam your country held them as villains, murders, and said a lot worse than what I had said. But hang on, I forgot, you’re American. The USA is the biggest hypocrites of us all.

Read full topic
